title: Don't support legacy Python
body_html: There is really no reason to support Python 2. Python 3 has been out for 8 years now. There are plenty of good articles written about this. Maintaining a dual codebase is a going to be a major pain and it prevents you from using a whole bunch of new Python 3 features (six only gets you so far).

Maintaining a dual codebase is a going to be a major pain and it prevents you from using a whole bunch of new Python 3 features (six only gets you so far).
body: There is really no reason to support Python 2. Python 3 has been out for 8 years now. There are plenty of good articles written about this. Maintaining a dual codebase is a going to be a major pain and it prevents you from using a whole bunch of new Python 3 features (`six` only gets you so far).
